item.title: Russian APT Releases More Deadly Variant of AcidRain Wiper Malware
item.description: New AcidPour variant can attack a significantly broader range of targets including IoT devices, storage area networks, and handhelds.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: AWS CISO: Pay Attention to How AI Uses Your Data
item.description: Amazon Web Services CISO Chris Betz explains why generative AI is both a time-saving tool as well as a double-edged sword.
item.dc:creator: Grant Gross, Contributing Writer, Dark Reading

item.title: Apple Stingy With Details About Latest iOS Update
item.description: The security update comes just weeks after the release of iOS 17.4, but Apple has not included CVEs or information about the fixes.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: 8 Strategies for Enhancing Code Signing Security
item.description: Strong code-signing best practices are an invaluable way to build trust in the development process and enable a more secure software supply chain.
item.dc:creator: Murali Palanisamy

item.title: Kenya to TikTok: Prove Compliance With Our Privacy Laws
item.description: Beleaguered social media platform now faces scrutiny by the Kenyan government over cybersecurity and data privacy.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Why AI Obituary Scams Are a Cyber-Risk for Businesses
item.description: Scammers now use AI to instantly whip up SEO-friendly bereavement scams, and it's never been easier to swindle mourners or use them to get to their employers.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Strata Identity Releases New Authentication Recipes
item.description: The Microsoft Identity Cookbook is a collection of orchestration recipes to help organizations adopt cloud-based identity providers.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Tesla Hack Team Wins $200K and a New Car
item.description: Zero Day Initiative awarded a total of $732,000 to researchers who found 19 unique cybersecurity vulnerabilities during the first day of Pwn2Own.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Changing Concepts of Identity Underscore 'Perfect Storm' of Cyber-Risk
item.description: Forgepoint Capital's Alberto YÃ©pez discusses how the concept of identity is changing: It doesn't just mean "us" anymore.
item.dc:creator: Kristina Beek, Associate Editor, Dark Reading

item.title: Ivanti Keeps Security Teams Scrambling With 2 More Vulns
item.description: Since the beginning of this year, the company has disclosed some seven critical bugs so far, almost all of which attackers have quickly exploited in mass attacks.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: NIST's Vuln Database Downshifts, Prompting Questions About Its Future
item.description: NVD may be in peril, and while alternatives exist, enterprise security managers will need to plan accordingly to stay on top of new threats.
item.dc:creator: David Strom

item.title: How Can We Reduce Threats From the Initial Access Brokers Market?
item.description: The ready-made access IABs offer has become an integral part of the ransomware ecosystem. Here's how to stop them before they can profit from your assets.
item.dc:creator: Edge Editors

item.title: 300K Internet Hosts at Risk for 'Devastating' Loop DoS Attack
item.description: Attackers can create a self-perpetuating, infinite scenario in such a way that volumes of traffic overwhelm network resources indefinitely.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer

item.title: Session Takeover Bug in AWS Apache Airflow Reveals Larger Cloud Risk
item.description: A bug exposed users of an AWS workflow management service to cookie tossing, but behind the scenes lies an even deeper issue that runs across all of the top cloud services.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Cyber Warfare: Understanding New Frontiers in Global Conflicts
item.description: An arms race is developing between those using technology to target adversaries and those using it prevent attacks from succeeding.
item.dc:creator: Gerasim Hovhannisyan

item.title: United Arab Emirates Faces Intensified Cyber-Risk
item.description: The UAE leads the Middle East in digital-transformation efforts, but slow patching and legacy technology continue to thwart its security posture.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: Using East-West Network Visibility to Detect Threats in Later Stages of MITRE ATT&CK
item.description: Ensuring that traffic visibility covers both client-server and server-server communications helps NetOps teams analyze and spot potential threats early on, avoiding catastrophic effects.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bienkowski

item.title: Federal Warning Highlights Cyber Vulnerability of US Water Systems
item.description: The White House urged operators of water and wastewater systems to review and beef up their security controls against attacks by Iran- and China-based groups.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Tax Hackers Blitz Small Business With Phishing Emails
item.description: Armed with little more than an email address, scammers are trying to trick small businesses and the self employed into giving up Social Security numbers.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken

item.title: Deloitte Launches CyberSphere Platform to Simplify Cyber Operations for Clients
Pathlock Introduces Continuous Controls Monitoring to Reduce Time and Costs
Akamai Research Finds 29% of Web Attacks Target APIs
Kaspersky Identifies Three New Android Malware Threats
India's Android Users Hit by Malware-as-a-Service Campaign
item.description: Hackers are seeking sensitive personal information on user devices, including banking data and SMS messages.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Don't Answer the Phone: Inside a Real-Life Vishing Attack
item.description: Successful attackers focus on the psychological manipulation of human emotions, which is why anyone, even a tech-savvy person, can become a victim.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer

item.title: After LockBit, ALPHV Takedowns, RaaS Startups Go on a Recruiting Drive
item.description: Law enforcement action hasn't eradicated ransomware groups, but it has shaken up the cyber underground and sown distrust among thieves.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: 'Fluffy Wolf' Spreads Meta Stealer in Corporate Phishing Campaign
item.description: Unsophisticated threat actor is targeting Russian companies with both readily available malware and authentic software.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer

item.title: AI Won't Solve Cybersecurity's Retention Problem
item.description: To fix retention and skills gaps, we need to encourage more women and minorities to build careers in cybersecurity.
item.dc:creator: Lisa Tetrault

item.title: Connectivity Standards Alliance Meets Device Security Challenges With a Unified Standard and Certification
item.description: The new IoT Device Security Specification 1.0, with accompanying certification, aims to offer a unified industry standard and increase consumer awareness.
item.dc:creator: Hollie Hennessy

item.title: Hackers Posing as Law Firms Phish Global Orgs in Multiple Languages
item.description: Companies trust lawyers with the most sensitive information they've got. Attackers are aiming to exploit that bond to deliver malware.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Russian Intelligence Targets Victims Worldwide in Rapid-Fire Cyberattacks
item.description: Russia's government is pretending to be other governments in emails, with an eye toward stealing strategic intel.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Detecting Cloud Threats With CloudGrappler
item.description: The open source tool from Permiso can help security teams identify threat actors lurking within their AWS and Azure environments.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Airbus Calls Off Planned Acquisition of Atos Cybersecurity Group
item.description: The purchase would have given Airbus more capabilities to address rising cyber threats in the aviation and aerospace industry.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Fortra Releases Update on Critical Severity RCE Flaw
item.description: The flaw has a CVSS rating of 9.8, and the company recommends product upgrades to fix the issue.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Cheating Hack Halts Apex Legends E-Sports Tourney
item.description: Electronic Arts is trying to track down the RCE exploit that allowed hackers to inject cheats into games during the recent Apex Legends Global Series.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken

item.title: 5 Ways CISOs Can Navigate Their New Business Role
item.description: CISOs can successfully make their business operations more secure and play a larger role in the organization's overall strategy, but there are pitfalls to avoid, Forrester analysts warn.
item.dc:creator: David Strom

item.title: Name That Toon: Bridge the Gap
item.description: Feeling creative? Submit your caption and our panel of experts will reward the winner with a $25 Amazon gift card.
item.dc:creator: John Klossner, Cartoonist

item.title: New Regulations Make D&O Insurance a Must for CISOs
item.description: CISOs currently hold all of the responsibility to stop cyberattacks yet have none of the authority to fund the technological defenses that regulations require.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Lawton, Contributing Writer

item.title: 'PhantomBlu' Cyberattackers Backdoor Microsoft Office Users via OLE
item.description: The cyber campaign uses social engineering and sophisticated evasion tactics, including a novel malware-delivery method, to compromise hundreds of Microsoft Office users.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Montalbano, Contributing Writer

item.title: The New CISO: Rethinking the Role
item.description: Rising cybersecurity demands are changing the role of the head security officer. CISOs need to make a list, check it at least twice, and document every step.
item.dc:creator: James Doggett

item.title: 'Conversation Overflow' Cyberattacks Bypass AI Security to Target Execs
item.description: Credential-stealing emails are getting past artificial intelligence's "known good" email security controls by cloaking malicious payloads within seemingly benign emails. The tactic poses a significant threat to enterprise networks.
item.dc:creator: Nathan Eddy, Contributing Writer

item.title: North Korea-Linked Group Levels Multistage Cyberattack on South Korea
item.description: Kimsuky-attributed campaign uses eight steps to compromise systems â from initial execution to downloading additional code from Dropbox, and executing code to establish stealth and persistence.
item.dc:creator: Robert Lemos, Contributing Writer

item.title: ML Model Repositories: The Next Big Supply Chain Attack Target
item.description: Machine-learning model platforms like Hugging Face are suspectible to the same kind of attacks that threat actors have executed successfully for years via npm, PyPI, and other open source repos.
item.dc:creator: Jai Vijayan, Contributing Writer

item.title: Chinese APT 'Earth Krahang' Compromises 48 Gov't Orgs on 5 Continents
item.description: The group uses pretty standard open source tooling and social engineering to burrow into high-level government agencies across the globe.
item.dc:creator: Nate Nelson, Contributing Writer

item.title: Saudi Arabia's National Cybersecurity Authority Announces the GCF Annual Meeting 2024
Brazilian Authorities Arrest Members of Banking Trojan Cybercrime Group
item.description: Interpol assisted in the operation, in which analysts identified Grandoreiro group members by analyzing and matching malware samples.
item.dc:creator: Dark Reading Staff

item.title: Fujitsu: Malware on Company Computers Exposed Customer Data
item.description: It remains unclear how long the IT services giant's systems were infiltrated and just how the cyberattack unfolded.
item.dc:creator: Becky Bracken

item.title: Tracking Everything on the Dark Web Is Mission Critical
item.description: On the Dark Web, stolen secrets are your enemy, and context is your friend.
item.dc:creator: Itzik Alvas

item.title: South African Government Pension Data Leak Fears Spark Probe
item.description: LockBit ransomware gang claims 668GB of data it dumped online was stolen from South Africa's pension agency.
item.dc:creator: John Leyden, Contributing Writer

item.title: 3 Ways Businesses Can Overcome the Cybersecurity Skills Shortage
item.description: With budget constraints and a limited supply of skilled talent, businesses need to get creative to defend against rampant cybersecurity threats.
item.dc:creator: Jesper Trolle
